meanings.definition: A range of colors seen in a rainbow or produced by separation of light
meanings.sent1: The spectra of the rainbow were so beautiful.
meanings.sent2: I marveled at the vibrant spectra of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The spectra of colors in the painting made it come alive.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter painted a spectra of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The spectra of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: A range of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the spectra of different light waves.
meanings.sent2: The radio telescope detected a unique spectra of signals.
meanings.sent3: The alien spaceship emitted a strange spectra of signals.
meanings.sent4: The spectra of energy pulsated through the air.
meanings.sent5: The spectra of radio waves filled the room with static.

meanings.definition: A range of elements or qualities
meanings.sent1: The spectra of flavors in the dish were delightful.
meanings.sent2: The spectra of talents in the team were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The spectra of personalities at the party made for an interesting mix.
meanings.sent4: The spectra of emotions in the room were palpable.
meanings.sent5: The spectra of scents in the garden were intoxicating.
